ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
Chinese.cooking_instructions: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch for 20 minutes. Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add chili peppers and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until golden. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 1 minute. Add peanuts and green onions, stir-fry for 1 minute. Add hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and Sichuan peppercorns. Stir-fry for 1 minute until sauce thickens. Season with salt and white pepper. Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
Chinese.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned, about 3 minutes. Add doubanjiang and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and Sichuan peppercorns. Add chicken stock and bring to simmer. Gently add tofu cubes and simmer for 3-4 minutes. Add cornstarch mixture and stir gently until sauce thickens. Add green onions and sesame oil. Season with salt if needed. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Clean and dry duck thoroughly. Mix honey, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, five-spice powder, and salt. Rub mixture all over duck, inside and out. Hang duck in a cool, dry place for 24 hours to dry skin. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Place duck on a rack in a roasting pan. Roast for 1 hour, then increase temperature to 400°F (200°C) and roast for additional 30 minutes until skin is crispy and golden. Let rest for 15 minutes. Carve duck into thin slices. Serve with pancakes, cucumber, green onions, and hoisin sauce.

Chop shrimp into small pieces. Mix with bamboo shoots, soy sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and sugar. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Mix wheat starch, tapioca starch, and salt. Add boiling water and stir until dough forms. Knead for 5 minutes until smooth. Divide into 20 pieces. Roll each piece into thin circles. Place 1 tablespoon filling in center of each wrapper. Fold edges to form pleats and seal. Steam in bamboo steamer for 8-10 minutes until translucent. Serve hot with soy sauce and chili oil.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
Chinese.cooking_instructions: Bring chicken stock to boil in a large pot. Add tofu, bamboo shoots, wood ear mushrooms, and lily flowers. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili oil, and white pepper. Stir in cornstarch mixture and simmer until soup thickens slightly. Slowly drizzle beaten eggs into soup while stirring gently to form ribbons. Add green onions and season with salt. Serve hot.

Japanese.cooking_instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Cook rice with water in a rice cooker or on stovetop. Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until dissolved. Fold vinegar mixture into hot rice. Let rice cool to room temperature. Wet hands with water and vinegar. Take a small amount of rice and form into oval shape. Place a small amount of wasabi on rice. Top with fish slice and press gently to adhere. Repeat with different fish. Serve with soy sauce and pickled ginger.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Japanese.cooking_instructions: Season pork cutlets with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, then coat with panko breadcrumbs. Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Fry cutlets for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Mix tonkatsu sauce, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Slice cutlets and serve with shredded cabbage and sauce.

Bring chicken stock to boil. Add soy sauce, mirin, and sake. Simmer for 10 minutes. Cook ramen noodles according to package directions. Drain and divide among 4 bowls. Ladle hot broth over noodles. Top with soft-boiled eggs, chashu pork, nori, green onions, bean sprouts, and corn. Drizzle with sesame oil and serve hot.

Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Mix flour, ice-cold water, and egg yolk to make tempura batter. Dip shrimp and vegetables in batter. Fry in hot oil for 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Mix dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and sake for dipping sauce. Serve tempura hot with dipping sauce.

Bring dashi stock to simmer. Add tofu and wakame seaweed. Simmer for 2 minutes. Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of hot stock, then add to soup. Add green onions and nori. Season with mirin and salt if needed. Serve hot.

Thai.cooking_instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add shrimp and tofu, stir-fry for 2 minutes. Push ingredients to one side and scramble eggs in the other side. Add noodles, fish sauce, tamarind paste, and palm sugar. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Add green onions and bean sprouts, stir-fry for 1 minute. Garnish with peanuts, lime wedges, and cilantro. Serve hot.

Bring chicken stock to boil. Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chilies, garlic, and galangal. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add shrimp and mushrooms, cook for 3-4 minutes until shrimp turn pink. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste. Garnish with green onions and cilantro. Serve hot.

Heat coconut milk in a large pot. Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 2 minutes until fragrant. Add chicken and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add eggplants, bamboo shoots, kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, and palm sugar. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until chicken is cooked and vegetables are tender. Add Thai basil and chilies. Garnish with green onions and cilantro. Serve hot with steamed rice.

In a mortar and pestle, pound chilies and garlic until crushed. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar, mix well. Add shredded papaya and tomatoes. Pound gently to combine. Add peanuts and dried shrimp. Toss well. Garnish with green onions and cilantro. Serve immediately.

Soak glutinous rice in water for 4 hours or overnight. Drain rice and steam for 20 minutes until tender. In a saucepan, heat coconut milk, sugar, and salt until sugar dissolves. Pour over hot rice and let absorb for 30 minutes. Arrange mango slices on serving plates. Top with sticky rice. Drizzle with coconut cream and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Korean.cooking_instructions: Mix soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger. Marinate beef for 2 hours. Heat a large skillet or grill. Cook beef with onions and carrots until done. Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions. Serve with rice and kimchi.

Heat sesame oil in a pot. Add pork belly and cook until browned. Add kimchi and cook for 5 minutes. Add water, gochujang, gochugaru, soy sauce, and sugar. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add tofu and onion. Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with green onions. Serve hot with rice.

Cook each vegetable separately in oil. Marinate beef in soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil. Cook beef until done. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Arrange rice in bowls. Top with vegetables, beef, and egg. Serve with gochujang and sesame seeds.

Mix flour, cornstarch, salt, and pepper. Coat chicken wings. Fry in hot oil until golden and crispy. For sauce, mix gochujang, soy sauce, honey, vinegar, garlic, and ginger. Toss fried chicken in sauce. Garnish with sesame oil and seeds. Serve immediately.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Marinate beef in soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil. Cook each vegetable separately. Cook beef until done. Mix noodles with vegetables and beef. Add garlic, sesame oil, and sesame seeds. Season with black pepper. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oil in wok. Scramble eggs and set aside. Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add rice and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add peas and cook for 1 minute. Add eggs, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Garnish with green onions. Season with salt and pepper.
Mix soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, ginger, and garlic. Heat oil in pan. Cook chicken for 4 minutes per side. Add sauce and simmer for 2 minutes. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve over rice.
Heat dashi stock to simmer. Dissolve miso paste in small amount of hot stock. Add to pot with tofu. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add green onions and nori. Season with soy sauce. Serve hot.

ingredients: Bean sprouts and lime wedges for serving
Korean.cooking_instructions: Soak noodles in hot water for 5 minutes. Heat oil and cook garlic for 30 seconds. Add shrimp and cook for 2 minutes. Push aside, add eggs and scramble. Add noodles, fish sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice. Toss for 2 minutes. Top with peanuts, bean sprouts, and lime wedges.
Cook ground beef until browned. Add soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger. Simmer for 3 minutes. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve over rice.

ingredients: Sriracha and hoisin sauce for serving
Korean.cooking_instructions: Heat broth to simmer. Cook noodles according to package directions. Add beef to hot broth for 1 minute. Divide noodles among bowls. Top with beef and broth. Garnish with green onions, cilantro, and basil. Add lime juice and fish sauce. Serve with sriracha and hoisin.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Heat oil and stir-fry garlic for 30 seconds. Add vegetables and cook for 2 minutes. Add noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Toss for 2 minutes. Drizzle with sesame oil and garnish with green onions.

ingredients: Nori strips and sesame seeds for garnish
Korean.cooking_instructions: Mix rice with rice vinegar. Top with salmon, avocado, and cucumber. Drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil. Garnish with nori strips and sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Heat oil and cook garlic and chilies for 30 seconds. Add ground chicken and cook for 4 minutes. Add fish sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice. Stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add basil leaves and toss. Serve over rice.

Heat oil and scramble eggs. Set aside. Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add rice and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add kimchi and cook for 1 minute. Add eggs, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Toss for 1 minute. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.

Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Score duck skin in diamond pattern. Mix honey, soy sauce, vinegar, and five-spice powder. Brush over duck. Place on wire rack in roasting pan. Roast 1.5 hours, basting every 20 minutes, until skin is crispy and golden. Let rest 15 minutes. Carve into thin slices. Serve with pancakes, cucumber, spring onions, and hoisin sauce.
Korean.chef_tips: The skin should be very crispy. Score the skin well for even cooking. The duck should be well-rested before carving. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
Korean.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in wok over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook until browned. Add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. Cook 1 minute until fragrant. Add stock, soy sauce, and sugar. Bring to boil. Add tofu gently. Simmer 5 minutes. Add cornstarch mixture, stir gently until thickened. Garnish with green onions and Sichuan peppercorns. Serve hot over rice.
Korean.chef_tips: Don't stir the tofu too much to keep it intact. The doubanjiang should be well-cooked. The sauce should be thick and glossy. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: Black vinegar and ginger for dipping
Korean.cooking_instructions: Make dough with flour and hot water. Knead until smooth, rest 30 minutes. Mix pork with soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, salt, green onions, and ginger. Add chilled stock, mix well. Roll dough thin, cut into circles. Place 1 tbsp filling in center. Pleat edges to seal. Steam 8-10 minutes until cooked through. Serve hot with vinegar and ginger dipping sauce.
Korean.chef_tips: The dough should be soft but not sticky. Don't overfill the dumplings. The pleating should be tight to seal. Steam until the wrappers are translucent.

ingredients: Sauce: 3 tbsp ketchup, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1/2 cup chicken stock
Salt and black pepper to taste
Korean.cooking_instructions: Season pork with salt and pepper. Dip in egg, then cornstarch. Heat oil in wok over medium-high heat. Fry pork until golden and crispy. Remove and set aside. Add bell pepper and onion, stir-fry 2 minutes. Add pineapple, cook 1 minute. Add sauce ingredients, bring to boil. Return pork to wok, toss to coat. Cook 2 minutes until heated through. Serve hot over rice.
Korean.chef_tips: The pork should be crispy on the outside. Don't overcook the vegetables. The sauce should be thick and glossy. Serve immediately while hot.

Korean.cooking_instructions: Bring stock to boil. Add tofu, mushrooms, and bamboo shoots. Simmer 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, vinegar, chili oil, white pepper, and sugar. Bring to boil. Slowly pour in beaten eggs while stirring. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add green onions and sesame oil. Serve hot.
Korean.chef_tips: The soup should be hot and sour. Don't overcook the eggs. The vegetables should be tender but not mushy. Serve immediately while hot.

Korean.cooking_instructions: Mix all ingredients except pork. Marinate pork for 2 hours minimum. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Place pork on rack in roasting pan. Roast 45 minutes, basting every 15 minutes, until cooked through and caramelized. Let rest 10 minutes. Slice thinly. Serve hot or at room temperature.
Korean.chef_tips: The pork should be well-marinated. Baste frequently for even color. The meat should be tender and juicy. Let it rest before slicing.

Korean.cooking_instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in wok over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook until browned. Add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. Cook 1 minute until fragrant. Add stock, soy sauce, and sugar. Bring to boil. Add noodles, toss to combine. Add sesame oil and green onions. Serve hot.
Korean.chef_tips: The noodles should be al dente. The sauce should be thick and flavorful. Don't overcook the noodles. Serve immediately while hot.

Korean.cooking_instructions: Mix pork with soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, salt, green onions, and ginger. Place 1 tsp filling in center of each wrapper. Wet edges, fold in half, seal tightly. Bring stock to boil. Add wontons, cook 5-7 minutes until they float. Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Garnish with green onions and cilantro. Serve hot.
Korean.chef_tips: Don't overfill the wontons. Seal the edges well. The wontons should float when cooked. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
Korean.cooking_instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok over medium-high heat. Scramble eggs until just set. Remove and set aside. Add remaining oil. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry 30 seconds. Add rice, break up clumps. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Add eggs, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Toss to combine. Add green onions. Season with salt and white pepper. Serve hot.
Korean.chef_tips: Use cold rice for best texture. Don't overcook the eggs. The rice should be well-separated. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
Korean.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until golden. Remove and set aside. Add peppercorns, doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. Cook 1 minute until fragrant. Add bell pepper, cook 2 minutes. Add chicken back to wok. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Add cornstarch mixture, stir until thickened. Add peanuts and green onions. Serve hot over rice.
Korean.chef_tips: The chicken should be golden and crispy. Don't overcook the vegetables. The sauce should be thick and glossy. Serve immediately while hot.

Vietnamese.cooking_instructions: Roast beef bones in oven at 400°F for 30 minutes. In a large pot, add bones, brisket, onion, ginger, and cover with water. Bring to boil, skim foam, then simmer for 3-4 hours. Toast spices in a dry pan until fragrant. Add to broth with fish sauce and sugar. Strain broth and return to pot. Cook rice noodles according to package directions. Slice brisket thinly. Divide noodles among bowls, top with brisket and raw sirloin. Pour hot broth over meat to cook it. Serve with herbs, lime, jalapeños, and bean sprouts.

ingredients: 1 lb pork belly or pork shoulder
Vietnamese.cooking_instructions: Marinate pork with fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and five-spice powder for 2 hours. Heat oil in a pan and cook pork until golden and cooked through, about 15 minutes. Slice pork thinly. Cut baguettes lengthwise, leaving one edge intact. Spread mayonnaise on both sides. Add pork, pickled vegetables, cucumber, cilantro, and jalapeños. Drizzle with sriracha. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 lb pork belly, cooked and sliced
Vietnamese.cooking_instructions: Cook rice vermicelli according to package directions. Mix hoisin sauce, peanut butter, water, garlic, lime juice, and sriracha for dipping sauce. Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water for 30 seconds until pliable. Place on damp towel. Add lettuce, herbs, noodles, shrimp, pork, cucumber, and bean sprouts. Roll tightly, tucking in sides. Serve with dipping sauce.

Mix ground pork with fish sauce, sugar, garlic, shallot, and black pepper. Form into small patties. Marinate sliced pork with same mixture. Grill pork patties and sliced pork until cooked through. Cook rice vermicelli according to package directions. Make dipping sauce with fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, garlic, chili, and water. Serve noodles with lettuce, herbs, cucumber, bean sprouts, and grilled pork. Serve with dipping sauce.

Cut fish into 2-inch pieces. Heat oil in a clay pot or heavy-bottomed pan. Add garlic, shallots, and ginger, cook until fragrant. Add sugar and cook until caramelized. Add fish sauce and coconut water. Add fish pieces and chilies. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until fish is cooked and sauce is reduced. Add green onions, black pepper, and lime juice. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Marinate pork in fish sauce, sugar, and garlic for 2 hours. Grill pork until cooked. Mix mayonnaise with Sriracha. Pickle vegetables in vinegar and sugar. Slice baguettes and spread with mayo mixture. Add pork, vegetables, cilantro, and jalapeños. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1/2 lb pork belly, cooked and sliced
For dipping sauce: 1/4 cup fish sauce
Vietnamese.cooking_instructions: Soak rice paper in warm water until pliable. Place shrimp, pork, noodles, and vegetables on wrapper. Add herbs and lettuce. Roll tightly. For sauce, mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, garlic, and chili. Serve rolls with dipping sauce.
